required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will conduct a proof-of-concept study to provide preliminary evidence of efficacy of physical exercise dose on ambulatory function in adults undergoing sub-acute stroke rehabilitation.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants admitted for stroke rehabilitation will be randomly assigned to either the Stroke Management Group, Stroke Monitoring Group or Stroke Supplementary Group. All three groups will receive usual care, in addition to the intervention. The Stroke Management Group will be provided with periodic information about their progress in the area of mobility using specialized activity monitors. The Stroke Monitoring Group will be progressed according to customized protocols using feedback from specialized activity monitors. The Stroke Supplementary Group will receive the same as the Stroke Monitoring Group, but will also receive one additional hour of daily (5 times per week) physical exercise

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Ambulatory function measured by the Six Minute Walk Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Ambulatory Function from the Six Minute Walk Test
Ambulatory function from the 5 Meter Walk Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Rehabilitation discharge (average 4-5 weeks post admission) , 6 and 12 months post-stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: Balance function from the Berg Balance Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Rehabilitation discharge (average 4-5 weeks post admission), 6 and 12 months post-stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: Ambulatory function from the Functional Ambulation Classification
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Rehabilitation discharge (average 4-5 weeks post admission), 6 and 12 months post-stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional level measured by the Functional Independence Measure
Quality of life measured with EuroQol
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Rehabilitation discharge (average 4-5 weeks post admission), 6 and 12 months post-stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognition measured by the Montreal Cognitive Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Rehabilitation discharge (average 4-5 weeks post admission), 6 and 12 months post-stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognition measured by the Digit Symbols Substitution Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Rehabilitation discharge (average 4-5 weeks post admission) , 6 and 12 months post-stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognition measured by the Trail Making Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Rehabilitation discharge (average 4-5 weeks post admission), 6 and 12 months post-stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression measured by Patient Health Questionnaire-9
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Rehabilitation discharge (average 4-5 weeks post admission) , 6 and 12 months post-stroke

arm_group.description: Participants will have usual care, and in addition, be provided with periodic information about their progress in the area of mobility using specialized activity monitors
Participants will have usual care, and in addition, be progressed according to customized protocols using feedback from specialized activity monitors
Participants will have usual care, and in addition, will receive the same as the Stroke Monitoring Group, and also receive one additional hour of daily (5 times per week) physical exercise

intervention.description: Participants will have usual care, and in addition, be provided with periodic information about their progress in the area of mobility using specialized activity monitors
Participants will have usual care, and in addition, be progressed according to customized protocols using feedback from specialized activity monitors
Participants will have usual care, and in addition, will receive the same as the Stroke Monitoring Group, and also receive one additional hour of daily (5 times per week) physical exercise

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have been admitted to a hospital unit for stroke rehabilitation
- Within 4 weeks post-stroke
- 19 years or older
- Are experiencing difficulty walking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Requires greater than one person assist for transfer or ambulation
- Have uncontrolled medical condition or another serious medication condition in addition to stroke
- Unable to understand or follow directions
